etymologies: late Middle English: via Latin from Greek skilla

definitions: a coastal Mediterranean plant of the lily family, with broad leaves, white flowers, and a very large bulb.
shortDefinitions: coastal Mediterranean plant of lily family, with broad leaves, white flowers

definitions: an extract of the bulb of the squill, which is poisonous and has medicinal and other uses.
shortDefinitions: extract of bulb of squill, which is poisonous and has medicinal and other uses

definitions: a small plant of the lily family, which resembles a hyacinth and has slender straplike leaves and small clusters of violet-blue or blue-striped flowers.

notes.text: Several species in the family Liliaceae, including the spring squill (Scilla verna), and the striped squill (Puschkinia scilloides)
